questions.question_text: On the System Diagnostics page, what is the default minimum size for a Work Plan to be considered big?
What will happen if a playbook debugger is left running for more than 24 hours?

choices.D: By default, the system closes automatically any debugger session that have been open 180 minutes.
choices.C: The session will be running till stopped manually by administrator.
choices.A: By default, every 24 hours, the system closes any debugger sessions that have been open for more than 180 minutes.
choices.B: The session must be stopped during 180 minutes manually by administrator, user will receive notification automatically.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A periodic check occurs every 24 hours, and any session exceeding 180 minutes is closed.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Answer is A, here is why:
Terminate Debugger Sessions

By default, every 24 hours, the system closes any debugger sessions that have been open for more than 180 minutes. You can change the frequency of the automatic terminations and also the length of time a debugger session can remain open. To change the default from 24 hours, go to Settings → About → Troubleshooting → Server Configuration and add the server configuration clean.playbook.debug.sessions.interval. The unit is hours.. To change the maximum time a debugger session can remain open, add the server configuration playbook.debug.sessions.duration.max. The unit is minutes.

questions.question_text: You need to retrieve a list of all malicious hashes over the last 30 days. What is the correct query to use?
What is the default configuration for indicator auto-extraction when incidents are created?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When an incident is created it is inline, while when a field changes it is out of band

This settings is found here >>> Under Settings >> Object Setup >> Types >> Edit a custom Type or Duplicate an existing one. Then under Indicators Extraction Rules you can select Use System default (inline), None, Inline or Out of Band
